section.title: Architecture Introduction
section.para: Each individual agent is composed by a set of components that provides different set of functionalities. The following section describe these internal components and their main responsabilities.

As you can see an individual agent is composed by three main components. The Core module, the Agent Communication Language module and an Utility module. Domain specific artifacts will usually be attached to the agent structure to solve domain specific problems and situations.

The Core module is reposible to host the internal mechanisms that the agent will use to react and expose an endpoint that will enable us to interact with it. How the agent internal structure will look like will be defined based on the configurations that we

The ACL module provides the Agent Communication Language Structures. This language is composed by 22 performatives that will enable the interactions between different agents. This ACL is based on FIPA-ACL, and right now there is a one to one mapping with the FIPA-ACL standard.

The Util module contains a set of helper classes that will be used to speed up and simplify the development process. Message Factories, Decoders/Encoders and general tools will be provided by this module.

Each of these three modules are represented by JAR packages in Java. That can be added as dependencies to your project using the following Maven artifacts:
groupId - org.drools.mas artifactId - drools-mas-core
groupId - org.drools.mas artifactId - drools-mas-acl
groupId - org.drools.mas artifactId - drools-mas-util
The following section goes deep in each of these components and analyze the simple Emergency Agent example.
